TECHNICAL_LOG

Reverse chronology with compressed summaries and direct jump to full notes.

  1. Family Guy Is Still a Masterpiece [2026.02.16]

    As someone living in New England, Family Guy always hits a little harder.The regional references, weather jokes, random local energy, and fast-pacedchaos all feel familiar in the best way.

  2. Verification-First Verilog Module Bring-Up [2026.02.15]

    I try to validate behavior before polishing implementation details. For studentprojects, this keeps logic drift under control when requirements evolve quickly.

  3. Current Mirror Mismatch Notes from Monte Carlo Runs [2026.01.28]

    Mismatch analysis gets useful only when the setup is consistent. I now save onetemplate testbench per topology and vary only geometry and bias points betweenruns.

  4. A Repeatable Static Timing Review Routine [2025.12.12]

    A timing report is only useful when reviewed with the same structure everytime. I use a short routine that keeps critical-path analysis readable forteammates.
